comments.body: is this really true? Are you sure it isn't `jupyter-notebook`?
You are probably right. This was really old.
But I guess it is just `notebook` now. Right?
That would be over-specifying it I think (it is a metapackage). `jupyter-notebook` is the _actual_ code installer (I think, though I will find out in the next few days).

Actually, this might not be required at all.

I believe we are just dropping some kernel spec files into a location for Jupyter client to find them. Though, I think there is another install step required. See this [example](http://ipython.readthedocs.org/en/stable/install/kernel_install.html#kernels-for-python-2-and-3) with `ipykernel`.

At most, we might need `jupyter_client`, but I'm not sure that it is even necessary to install the kernel. Still users might expect something they can install and do something with. So we need to find a balance between an install with the required dependencies and a usable install.

Here is Continuum's [`irkernel` recipe](https://github.com/conda/conda-recipes/blob/master/r-packages/r-irkernel/meta.yaml). Note it does not install any Jupyter packages.
Alas, I was wrong anyway, it was `notebook` not `jupyter-notebook`. I packaged it a few days ago ðŸ˜´  ðŸ˜„
